did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Catalogs from the Collins Company showing the products they manufactured and sold. Some of the catalogs are in Spanish and Portuguese. The Collins Company had factories in South America and Central America.Tools include axes, podaderas, adges, machetes, hoes, plows, fire axes, etc...

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: limited access to actual catalogs. Digital scans available.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Canton Historical Society (Collinsville, Conn).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], , [Box no]., Canton Historical Society (Collinsville, Conn)

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Compiled from various sources including local citizens and documents found after the closing of the Collins Company.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: The Collins Company purchased land on the Farmington River in what is now the Collinsville section of Canton, Connecticut in 1826 for the sole purpose of starting an axe factory. Sam Collins, brother David Collins, and their cousin William Welles, started the company with the idea of building a better axe, using mass production techniques. The Collins Company expanded from just axes to farm equipment, machetes, and other edge tools.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Catalogs containing information on: axes, adzes, plows, podaderas, hoes, machetes, knives, bowie knives, fire axes, hatchets, picks, cane knives, hammers, broad axes, bush hooks, chisels, cleavers, mattocks, sledges, cast iron and Dycast tools. Black and white pictures and color pictures of items.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
